Cinderella's father marries a wicked stepmother .
and then he passes away leaving Cinderella alone with the stepmother and stepsisters . 174180_174230
they are not nice to Cinderella .
and they make her work very hard in the house serving them food and doing their chores .
the king decides to throw a big ball in honor of the son his [//] the prince who needs to find a wife .
the &+s wicked stepsisters are happy to be going to the ball but they do not want Cinderella to attend .
so ‡ they make sure that her dress is ruined and that she cannot go to the ball . 174230_174240
Cinderella is lucky because the good fairy stepmother [
she tells Cinderella that she must be home by midnight or the dress will be gone , and the coach will be back turned into a pumpkin , and she will not have the pretty dress .
Cinderella goes to the ball and has a wonderful time with the prince .
at the strike [
and as she is running she loses one of her glass slippers .
she gets home and only has the one slipper .
the prince goes all over town looking for the owner of the slipper .
he wants that girl to be his wife .
he finally gets to Cinderella's house .
and she tries on the slipper . 174240_174300
it matches the one that's missing .

the end .
I was hospitalized when I was thirty years old &-uh for a heart issue . 175060_175070
I had open heart surgery . 175070_175240
&-um I remember &-uh waking up with a breathing tube down my throat .
and I wasn't able to see because I wear contacts .
and I didn't have my contacts in and everything was very blurry .
and people were moving around a_lot .
and I remember being thirsty but nobody would give me anything to drink .
&-um I was in the i_c_u for several hours waiting for them to take the breathing tube out_of my throat .
once they did I was moved to regular room .
and I was in pain for a very long time .
say that again . 177060_177190
&-um my grandfather had a stroke and &-um now he can't talk .
I don't live here in town so I don't see him very often .
&-um when I come to visit it's very hard for me to communicate with him because I can't understand what he's saying .
he really tries hard to make sounds and point to things and make hand motions but it's [/] &-uh it's difficult to understand .
so ‡ I watch him very closely and I try to hand motion back &-uh trying to match what he's doing to maybe think about what he may be trying to say .
I watch his lip movements but &-um sometimes that's not so successful .
oh .
&-um the last time I was really scared &-uh it was the middle of the night .
and &-uh I listened to the baby on the &-uh monitor .
and all_of_a_sudden I heard that she was having trouble breathing .
so ‡ I jumped up out_of bed and ran in there and picked her up .
and she was crying . 179555_179645
and I held her for a few minutes and tried to get her calmed down .
and then I gave her a bottle . 179935_180045
and &-uh we called the doctor immediately .
you take two slices of white bread and put them on a plate .
you take the peanut butter with a knife .
spread the peanut butter on both sides of the white bread .
after that you take the jelly and spread the jelly on both sides on top of the peanut butter .
then you take the bread and close the sandwich and cut a slice down the middle .
